titleInfo.title: Coll 25/8 'Orders in Council: Registration of British subjects and protected persons abroad'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the back to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 175; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence, drafts, minute papers, memoranda, and reports concerning matters connected to the registration of British subjects and protected persons in foreign countries. The first part of the file consists of the interdepartmental discussion following the release of a Foreign Office report on British communities abroad (Miscellaneous No.8 (1920) - folios 167-74) which dealt with the matters of registration of British subjects, protected persons, and those naturalized in India and resulted in amended orders in Council for Maskat [Muscat], China (Kashgar), Bahrein [Bahrain], and the Persian Islands (see folios 103-26) in 1922.Further matters dealt with later in the file include:Collection of feesThe question of dual nationalityIssuing of passportsRegistration of British Indians in China with unsatisfactory documentary evidence of nationalityRegistration of Indians in possession of Singapore Emergency Certificates or Hong Kong Police PermitsCorrespondence is between officials at the Foreign Office, India Office, Government of India (Foreign and Political Department), Colonial Office, British Legation in Peking [Beijing], British Minister at Amoy [Xiamen], the Economic and Overseas Department, and Government House in Singapore.
